intro: Ligustrum oblongifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf privet, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features small, opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically 2–6 cm long. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by dark blue berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its adaptability and tolerance to various soil conditions. Ligustrum oblongifolium is also valued for its use in landscaping and as a hedge plant.
